Times begins its story with Donald Rumsfeld 's account about being told by George W. Bush two weeks after the 9/11 attacks, to prepare review the Pentagon's plans for a war with Iraq. According to the Times: Two weeks after the worst terrorist attack in our nation's history, those of us in the Department of Defense were fully occupied, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld recalls. But the George W. Bush insisted on new military plans for Iraq, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes. "He wanted the options to be` creative." '

Micah Zenko , a political scientist at the Council on Foreign Relations, extensively researched U.S. planning for a military strike on Khurmal in 2002 and detailed it in his book, Between Threats and War. He said in an interview that he was unaware that Rumsfeld had advocated bombing the place while Colin Powell was at the U.N. By that time, the Khurmal camp had been largely empty for months, Micah Zenko said

admits he's given up hope of getting the award himself. Bruce Forsyth , 82, reckons he will never receive a knighthood because the Queen doesn't reward comics, like Eric Sykes . He said: Why were Morecambe and Wise never knighted? "The Two Ronnies, why were they never knighted? Our comedic people never get knighted.
